instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-02020 5V 450mA
threads.message: Hello, I have an 820-02020 M1 machine here with 5V and taking .450mA. This board has a ton of corrosion everywhere, some of which I have cleaned up. I have replaced the ISL9240. Currently, U8100 gets warm, but not burning. It sits at 40C under thermal cam. PPBUS_AON and PP3V8_AON both measure at 8.2V I know this isn't correct, but I am unsure HOW they have the same voltage values. The same behavior is exhibited in the enclosure. Corrosion hit the backlight circuit area, as well as left speaker area and keyboard and trackpad connector area. No liquid was found on or near U8100. Im a little lost on where to go from here. PPBUS_AON is 250 ohms to ground. diode mode is 0.145 when it should be around .500.

threads.title: 820-02020 5V 450mA
threads.message:
With 8.2V at 3V8_AON M1 CPU is fried; don't waste more time with it.
Because of corrosion, (at least) one of Q5800/20/40 got burnt and shorted PPBUS_AON to 3V8_AON.
